metadata.Title: CVE-2017-2835 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
An exploitable code execution vulnerability exists in the RDP receive functionality of FreeRDP 2.0.0-beta1+android11. A specially crafted server response can cause an out-of-bounds write resulting in an exploitable condition. An attacker can compromise the server or use a man in the middle to trigger this vulnerability.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-2835` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

freerdp-x11 - 1.0.2-2ubuntu1.1
libfreerdp-plugins-standard - 1.0.2-2ubuntu1.1
libfreerdp1 - 1.0.2-2ubuntu1.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: freerdp package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.0.2-2ubuntu1.1').
